Membro dell' Editorial Board di 'Archaica' (http://www.f.bg.ac.rs/archaica/English.html) rivista di archeologia dell'Universita` di Belgrado
Membro della Commissione Scientifica della rivista archeologica di 'Patrimonium Banaticum' (Romania)

Organizzazione o partecipazione come rel.content: Relazione presentata su "Impressed Ware, Danilo and Hvar Cultures along the Dalmatian coastline: pottery production and technology" alla Croatian Archaeological Society annual conference tenutasi a Vukovar (Croazia)

Relazione presentata all'Universita` di Leicester (UK) al Ceramic Petrology Group Annual Meeting su "Circulation and production of everyday pottery and prestige items in the Early and Middle Neolithic Adriatic region"

Relazione presentata al 9th Annual Meeting of the European Association of Archaeologists (EAA) a S. Pietroburgo (Russia) su "Ceramic vessels, ‘ritual’ and art objects in the Balkan Peninsula: an archaeometrical approach to the study of the last hunter-foragers and the first farmers of south-eastern Europe"
Seminario presentato al Museo di Scienze Naturali di Trieste su "Similarities and differences in the Neolithic of South and Southeastern Europe"

Co-organizzatrice (con i Professori S. Shennan [UCL Institute of Archaeology] e P. Biagi [Ca’ Foscari University]) del simposio internazionale "A Short Walk Through the Balkans: the First Farmers of the Carpathian Basin and Adjacent Regions" tenutosi all' Istituto di Archeologia, University College London

Relazione presentata "Pottery production and circulation in the Balkan Neolithic" all'Istituto di Archeologia, University College London durante il workshop "A Short Walk Through the Balkans: the First Farmers of the Carpathian Basin and Adjacent Regions"

Relazione presentata al Römisch-Germanischen Zentralmuseums (Mainz, Germania) su "The Neolithisation of the Central Balkans: Leapfrogging diffusion and cultural transmission" al convegno su "The Spread of the Neolithic to Central Europe: Current Research and Future Prospects"

Realzione presentata all'Universita` di Udine su "A technological formula for Neolithic pottery production in Romania: archaeometric investigation" al Workshop sulle Ceramiche Balcaniche organizzato dal Dr Fabbri (Institute of Science and Technology for Ceramics, Faenza)

Co-organizzatrice (con il Prof. P. Biagi [Ca’ Foscari University], Dr D. Ciobotaru [Director of Banat Museum, Timişoara] e Prof. F. Draşovean [Banat Museum]) del simposio tenutosi a Timişoara (Romania) "The Origin of the Neolithic in South-East and Central Europe". Relazione presentata: "The earliest pottery production in the Central Balkans"

Relazione presentata all'Universita` di Sheffield (UK) su "The earliest potters in the Central Balkans: technological choices and cultural transmission" durante il meeting annuale del "Ceramic Petrology Group"
Relazione presentata su invito all' "English Ceramic Circle" (Somerset House, Londra) su "Scientific analysis of three porcelain objects from Burghley House"
Relazione presentata "Inside ceramics: clay sources and technological choices" al 'Cross-departmental Seminar on Ceramics Research' al British Museum (Londra)

Co-organizzatrice del simposio internazionale tenutosi al British Museum "EMAC09. European Meeting on Ancient Ceramics" Co-organizzatori: C. Cartwright, Dr C. Higgitt (The British Museum), A. Hunt, Prof. T. Rehren, e Dr M. Martinon-Torres (UCL Institute of Archaeology)

Co-presentatrice (con Dr A. Fletcher, The British Museum) della relazione su "Heartland and periphery: petrographic and chemical analyses of Halaf fine ware production" at EMAC 2009 (European Meeting on Ancient Ceramics), held at the British Museum (London). Allo stesso evento, co-presentatrice del poster (con N. Meeks, M. Bimson and A. Dawson) su "Seventeenth-century England: early attempts to make the ‘Arcanum’ "

Presidente e moderatore della sessione "Composition and manufacture of the clay tablets" ad ICAANE7 International Congress on the Archaeology of the Ancient Near East, co-organizzata dal British Museum e University College London
Presentazione relazione "Eastern Mediterranean connections: mortaria production in the Archaic and Classical periods" al Ceramic Petrology Group Annual Meeting presso l'Universita` di Nottingham (UK)

Presentatrice relazione su "Eastern Mediterranean connections in the Archaic and Classical period: petrographic study of mortaria" al British Museum per Arts and Humanities Research Council (AHRC) e Italian Centre for National Research
Presentatrice relazione (con Dr M. Millet, Collège de France) "The ceramics at Amara West, Sudan" alla "Nubian Studies Conference" tenutasi al British Museum

Co-organizzatrice del simposio (con Dr A. Villing [The British Museum] e Prof. L. Foxhall [Leicester University, UK]) "Ceramics, Cuisine and Culture: the Archaeology and Science of Kitchen Pottery in the Ancient Mediterranean World" tenutosi al British Museum

Presentazione (con Dr A. Villing) poster "Mortaria production and trade in the Archaic and Classical Mediterranean" al simposio "Ceramics, Cuisine and Culture: the Archaeology and Science of Kitchen Pottery in the Ancient Mediterranean World", British Museum

Poster presentato (con Dr J. Meadows, ZBSA and Leibniz Labor, Kiel) su "The start of the Neolithic in the Balkan Peninsula" al simposio "Radiocarbon and Archaeology 6th International Symposium" a Pafos, Cipro

Relazione presentata al "Fünfter Archäologischer Workshop, Naturwissenschaftliche Analysen vor- und frühgeschichtlicher Keramik: Methoden, Anwendungsbereiche, Auswertungsmöglichkeiten", Universita` di Amburgo (Germania). Titolo relazione: "Early-Middle Neolithic pottery production in the Adriatic: the emergence of craft specialisation"

Relatrice al simposio "International Symposium on Ancient Ceramics - Its Scientific and Technological Insights (ISAC 2012) (Jingdezhen, Cina)", relazione presentata "Provenance and manufacturing choices in New Kingdom ceramic production, Amara West (Nubia, Sudan)"

Relatrice al "Sechster Archäologischer Workshop, Naturwissenschaftliche Analysen vor- und frühgeschichtlicher Keramik: Methoden, Anwendungsbereiche, Auswertungsmöglichkeiten", Universita` di Amburgo. Relazione presentata "Technological choices of pottery manufacture at the New Kingdom site of Amara West, Nubia"

Relatrice alla Round Table su "The Relative vs Absolute Chronology of the Carpathian Basin and South-Eastern Europe" 19th Annual Meeting of the European Association of Archaeologists (Plzen, Czech Republic) . Relazione presentata (con Dr J. Meadows, ZBSA and Leibniz Labor, Kiel): "Decorated pottery as a chronological marker in the early Neolithic of the Carpathian Basin" (http://proposal.eaa2013.cz/programme/eaa-2013-final-programme.pdf p. 186)

Relatrice su invito alla conferenza "Recent Approaches to Ancient Ceramics in Archaeology", relazione presentata "Cultural and technological changes of ceramics at the transition from Early to Middle Neolithic of south-eastern Europe" presso l' Istituto di Archeologia (Russian Academy of Science, Moscow)
Co-organizzatrice con Dr. R. Tomber della giornata studio al British Museum "The Ceramic Petrology Group Annual Meeting"

Relatrice al 20th Annual Meeting of the European Association of Archaeologists Istanbul (Turchia). Relazione presentata "From Starčevo to Vinča: technological developments in ceramic production" nella sessione "New data on social complexity in the Balkans and around: prehistoric societies from the 5th millennium BC".

Serbian Academy of Sciences (Belgrado, Serbia): invited speaker, chair di una sessione e moderatore della discussion finale al "Workshop Tracing pottery making recipes in the Balkans, 6th–4th millennium BC". Relazione presentata: "Tradition and change in pottery technology: the early and middle Neolithic in Dalmatia and in the central Balkans"

Corripoli (Teramo): relatrice su invite alla conferenza "The Right to Beauty: the Preservation and Enhancement of Cultural Heritage (Ripoli, Italy)" (supported by UNESCO); relazione presentata "L’emergere dell’artigianato specializzato nel neolitico del sud-est europeo"

Relazione presentata all'Universita` di Amburgo (Germania) "The ceramic assemblage from the Pre-Pottery Neolithic B site of Boncuklu Höyük in central Anatolia" al workshop "Siebter Archäologischer Workshop für junge Wissenschaftler/Innen Naturwissenschaftliche Analysen vor- und Frühgeschichtlicher Keramik: Methoden, Anwendungsbereiche, Auswertungsmöglichkeiten"
Co-organizzatrice del simposio "International workshop on cuneiform clay tablets" con D. Ling, J. Taylor, I. Finkel al British Museum, Londra
Relatrice all' "International workshop on cuneiform clay tablets" al British Museum; relazione presentata "What can archaeometric analyses tell us about the cuneiform tablets"

University of Namur, Faculty of Arts (Belgium), invited speaker al workshop “Matières à Penser: raw material acquisition and processing in Early Neolithic pottery production”. Relazione presentata: "Continuity and change: the Neolithic ceramics of south and southern-eastern Europe"
Samara University (Russia) invited speaker al simposio "Modern approaches and methods in ceramics research"; relazione presentata: "First impressions of early Neolithic Russian pottery technology"
Presentatrice della relazione su "Late Neolithic tell site of Domuztepe, Turkey" ad un workshop organizzato da Dr A. Fletcher al British Museum (Middle East department) London

Relatrice al convegno International Symposium on Ancient Ceramics (ISAC2015). Presidente di sessione su "Asian ceramics" allo stesso convegno. Relazione presentata "Technological insights into Mycenaean pottery from Nubia (Sudan) and its circulation patterns in the Mediterranean (Shanghai, China)"

University of Zagreb (Croatia): keynote speaker con una relazione su "Archaeometric analysis of pottery as a tool for detecting in-depth technological and social-economic insights and changes" at MetArch Conference (Department of Archaeology, Faculty of Humanities and Social Sciences of the University of Zagreb and Croatian Archaeological Society)

Organizzatrice principale, sessione 1 giorno di “Blurred borders? Making pottery and cultural interaction in Neolithic and Eneolithic Europe”. Collaboratori Dr R. Hofmann (Christian-Albrechts-Universität zu Kiel, Institute of Pre- & Protohistory Kiel, Germany) e Ass. Prof. J. Vuković (Faculty of Philosophy, Department of Archaeology University of Belgrade, Belgrade, Serbia). 22nd Annual Meeting of the European Association of Archaeologist, Vilnius, Lithuania

Relatrice (con Dr. R. Hofmann, Kiel University, Germany) alla EAA 2016 (Vilnius, Lituania) con relazione su "Mixed Vinča and Tisza assemblages of the Borđoš-Plain, Vojvodina: contextualisation and technology"

Responsabilita' di studi e ricerche scie.content: Christian-Albrechts-Universität zu Kiel, Institute of Prehistoric and Protohistoric Archaeology, Germany: responsabile dello studio archeometrico delle ceramiche del Neolitico finale delle culture di Tisza e Vinča provenienti dal sito Borđos (Vojvodina, Serbia) con il Dr Robert Hofmann

Samara State Academy of Social Sciences and Humanities, Samara, Russia: responsabile dello studio scientifico delle ceramiche provenienti da una serie di siti del Neolitico antico della Russia centrale e meridionale in collaborazione con il Prof. Aleksandr Vybornov

National Institute of Archaeology with Museum – BAS, Sofia, Bulgaria: responsabile degli studi archeometrici delle ceramiche preistoriche del sito di Nova Nadezhda (Bulgaria) con il Prof. Krum Bacvarov

Dottorato di Ricerca in Preistoria e Protostoria Europea, Universita` degli Studi di Udine, Dipartimento di Storia e Tutela dei Beni Culturali, XIV ciclo

Docente a contratto per il corso in Preistoria dei Balcani per la specialistica in Archeologia e Conservazione dei Beni Culturali all'Universita` Ca’ Foscari (ogni corso 15 h di insegnamento frontale + tutorials, correzione tesine ed esami orali)

Leverhulme Post-doctoral Research Fellow per il progetto "The early Neolithic in the Balkans: ceramic analysis and cultural processes" presso l'Istituto di Archeologia, University College London, Londra, UK. Main applicants Prof. S. Shennan (UCL, IoA) and Prof. P. Biagi (Ca’Foscari University) (Borsa F/07 134/AD)

Scientist al Dipartimento di Ricerca Scientifica, British Museum, London (UK)
Contributi alle lezioni di laurea triennale e specialistica in Paletnologia (Universita` Ca’ Foscari, Venezia)
Esaminatrice del Dottorato di Ricerca di Raja Ishtiaq Ahmed, Taxila Institute of Asian Civilizations, Quaid-I-Azam University, Islamabad, Pakistan

Istituto di Archeologia (UCL): co-supervisore di Beatrijs de Groot (studentessa di dottorato) con Prof. S. Shennan (UCL, London) e Dr U. Sommer (UCL, London)

University of Oxford, Research Laboratory for Archaeology and the History of Art (UK):(1h) lezione per docenti e studenti su "Technological innovation and conservatism in 6th–5th millennium BC ceramics from southern Europe and Anatolia"

Paris 1 Sorbonne (France): (2h) lezione su "Patterns and strategies in ceramic production of the first farmers of southern and south-­eastern Europe" agli studenti di archeologia dell' Universita` Sorbonne Paris 1

Paris 1 Sorbonne (France): (1.5h) lezione agli studenti di dottorato e al gruppo di ricerca del MAE and CNRS su "Potters’ choices: Middle Neolithic ceramic technical innovations and regionalisation in southern Europe (5 500-4500 calBC)"
National Institute of Archaeology with Museum, Bulgarian Academy of Sciences, Sofia (Bulgaria): (1h ) public lecture

Universita` di Trento: (2h) lezione agli studenti di dottorato e post-dottorato e ai docenti su "La produzione ceramica dell’Europa meridionale e sudorientale nel VI e V millennio a. C.: tradizione e innovazione attraverso le analisi archeometriche"

Parker Pearson (UCL, Institute of Archaeology)
